summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing plans to execute a search warrant on Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The email outlines tentative travel plans for FBI agents and ERT (Evidence Response Team) to conduct a search expected to last 1-3 days, with the warrant affidavit being drafted by SDNY (Southern District of New York).

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the subject of the search warrant for his private island off St. Thomas, which is being drafted by SDNY.

events.title: Search warrant sworn out in St. Thomas
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting a search warrant affidavit for Epstein's island, with the expectation that the warrant will be sworn out on Friday in St. Thomas.

events.title: FBI travel to St. Thomas
events.description: FBI agents plan to fly out on the FBI Q400 plane to St. Thomas to execute the search warrant on Epstein's island.

events.title: Search of Epstein's island
events.description: The search of Epstein's island off St. Thomas is expected to take 1-3 days, managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT).

events.title: FBI travel home
events.description: Thursday is planned as the travel day home for FBI personnel after completing the search of Epstein's island.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas in August 2019.
The FBI planned to execute the search warrant using their Q400 plane, with travel scheduled for August 11, 2019.
The search was expected to take 1-3 days and would be managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT).
The email correspondence shows coordination between FBI personnel in New York regarding the logistics of the search operation.
The document indicates active investigation into Epstein's activities following his arrest, focusing on his properties outside the United States.
